alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 27 at 12:49PM EST until January 27 at 2:45PM EST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWESTERN OKALOOSA AND NORTHERN SANTA ROSA COUNTIES... At 1149 AM CST, Santa Rosa County 911 reported water covering the road at Munson Highway and Highway 4 in Munson. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in northeast Santa Rosa and northwest Okaloosa Counties. While the heaviest rain has moved east of the warned area, additional water rises and flash flooding remains possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baker, Roeville, Point Baker, Munson, Kellys Mill, Indian Ford, Floridale, Holt, Belandville, Rock Creek, McLellan, Harold, Berrydale, Sellersville, Nubbin Ridge, Cannon Town, Allentown, Blackman, Escambia Farms and Good Hope. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
